summarized_judgment: kumar bijan kr. ( cj ) j. ( mukherjea c. j. ), vivian jagannadhadas, b. aiyyar, t. l. venkatarama sinha, bhuvneshwar. ( bj ) gandhi memorial medical college indore.

tagline: Nanak Chand vs The State Of Punjab on 25 January, 1955
summarized_judgment: no offence created there by - ss. 34 and 149 of the indian penal code - distinction between the two - code of criminal procedure ( act v of 1898 ) the two sections are not to be confused. the principal element in s. 34 is the common intention to commit a crime.

tagline: Ameer-Un-Nissa Begum & Ors vs Mahboob Begum & Ors on 14 January, 1955
summarized_judgment: ameer - un - nissa begum & ors... ands. the case no longer has been heard in the u. s. for more than 40 years. the petitioner has been accused of being a victim of a gang of over - 65s.

tagline: Girja Datt Singh vs Gangotri Datt Singh on 25 January, 1955
summarized_judgment: two appeals by special leave arise out of two separate proceedings. one under the u. p. encumbered estates act, e. e. act case no. 11 of 1936 and the other a title suit. the deceased died on 15 - 5 - 1933 leaving him surviving bhaiya girja datt singh.

tagline: Mahant Salig Ram vs Musammat Maya Devi on 21 January, 1955
summarized_judgment: the general custom of punjab is entitled to an initial presumption in favour of the daughter's succession to the self - acquired property of her father. it is well - settled that a daughter excludes the collaterals from succession to self acquired property. general custom is based in gurdaspur district of the punjab, where the riwaj - i - am is opposed to the custom.

tagline: Amrik Singh vs The State Of Pepsu on 28 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: aiyyar, t. l. venkatarama das, sudhi ranjan bhagwati, natwarlal h. velkar. court heard that sanction is necessary for prosecution under s. 197 ( 1 ) of the code of criminal procedure. if asked, it could be claimed to have been done by virtue of the office, sanction would be necessary.

tagline: The Automobile Products Of India ... vs Rukmaji Bala And Others(And ... on 3 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: sudhi ranjan bhagwati, natwarlal h. imam, syed jaffervedi and others. the two now ss. 33 and 33 - a inserted in the industrial di - - putes act 1947 ( xiv of 1947 ) by act xlviii of 1950 ( xx of 1950 ) confers on the 1242 workmen an additional remedy.

tagline: Hans Muller Of Nurenburg vs Superintendent, Presidency ... on 23 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: petitioner was placed under pre - ventive detention act 1950 on the ground that he was a foreigner within the meaning of the foreigners act 1946. the petitioner, a west german subject, was placed in pre - term detention by an order of the west bengal government under s. 3 ( 1 ) of the tourists act.

tagline: The Collector Of Bombay vs Nusserwanji Rattanji Mistri & ... on 28 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: in the island of bombay certain lands were held on a tenure known as " foras " under s. 2 of bombay act vi of 1851, occupants were entitled to hold the lands subject only to the payment of revenue then payable. in 1942 the appellant acting under the. foras land act ( bombay act ii of 1876 ) issued notices to the respondents proposing to levy assessment on the lands at the rates mentioned therein.

tagline: Rishideo Pande vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 3 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: the high court gave banslochan the benefit of doubt and rejected the reference and allowed the appeal so far as it concerned him. the appeal is by rishideo alone. the main point urged by sri umrigar who appears in support of this appeal is that section 34 have been wrongly applied to the facts.

tagline: Shyabuddinsab Mohidinsab Akki vs The Gadag-Betgeri Municipal ... on 22 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: the first respondent - municipality governed by the municipal boroughs act, 1925 ( bombay act xviii of 1925 ) consists of 32 councillors, s, ( the appellant ) being one of them. the last general election to the municipality took place on the 7th may 1951. the term of respondents 4 and 5 was to expire at the end of three years.

tagline: Sri 5 Sita Maharani And Ors. vs Chhedi Mahto And Ors. on 3 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: a court granted a certificate for leave to appeal the court's decision. raja mohan bikram shah was the proprietor of the ramnager raj. the land in suit appertains to khata no. 2 of village ratni for a period of 31 years. they had pleaded adverse possession but this plea was abandoned at the trial.

tagline: The State Of Bihar vs Kumar Amar Singh And Others(And ... on 10 February, 1955

tagline: Sm. Ram Devi vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 22 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: appellant along with 5 other persons was charged under section 366, penal code, for kidnapping or abducting one chameli, a minor daughter of a railway employee one net ram, in order she may be forced or seduced to illicit intercourse. both were also charged with having committed offences under various sections of the penal code.

tagline: Gurbakhsh Singh vs State Of Punjab on 16 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: judgment s. r. das, j. 1. gurbakhsh singh, piara singh and his brother's son jawahri were sent up for trial. additional sessions judge acquitted labh singh under section 302 and section 307. the high court has dismissed his appeal and accepted the reference the present appeal.

tagline: State Of Bombay vs Mulji Jetha And Co. on 10 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: two appeals on leave granted by the high court of bombay under article 133 ( 1 ) ( c ) of the constitution against its common judgment in second appeals nos. 936 and 937 of 1947. the appellant in each appeals is the state of bombay and the respondent is mulji jetha.

tagline: Ram Narain vs State Of Punjab on 11 February, 1955
summarized_judgment: appellant was posted as an accountant in ferozpore district. on 7 - 2 - 1950 he withdrew from the treasury a sum of rs. 11, 579 - 8 - 0 on the strength of a contingent voucher being a subsistence allowance bill for the month of february, 1950. appellant is charged that he fraudulently fraudulently and dishonestly used as forged document.

tagline: Sangram Singh vs Election Tribunal, Kotah,Bhurey ... on 22 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: bose, vivian benchmark of the people act ( act xliii ) of 1951, section 105 effect of - finality and conclusiveness of orders of election tribunals. supreme court and supreme court have unfettered jurisdiction to examine whether the tribunal has acted legally or otherwise. high courts and justices can determine what the law of the land is vis - a - vis allegation.

tagline: Seth Thawardas Pherumal vs The Union Of India(And Connected ... on 24 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: both parties specifically refer a question of law for the decision of arbitrator - case. but both parties are bound by his decision on a number of grounds. but a distinction must be drawn between cases in which a dispute is covered by it. the union of india, which contested the award, contested award on grounds. it is not enough for the contract to provide for arbitration, more is necessary.

tagline: Sahu Madho Das And Others vs Pandit Mukand Ram And Another(And ... on 22 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: a compromise or family arrangement is based on assumption that there is an antecedent title of some sort in the parties. it is assumed that the title claimed by the person receiving the property under the arrangement had always lived in him or her so far as the property falling to his share and recognising the right of the others, as they had previously claimed it.

tagline: Jugalkishore Saraf vs Raw Cotton Co. Ltd on 7 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: application by transferee - applicability of order xxi, rule 16 and s. 146 - equitable principles transfer of property act ( iv of 1882 ), ruled 16 - debt transferred pending suit thereon - decree not. mentioned in deed - execution of the appellant. h & s filed suit against appellant for recovery of money and during pendency of suit.

tagline: U.J.S. Chopra vs State Of Bombay on 25 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: appellant was convicted by the presidency magistrate of an offence under s. 66 ( b ) of the bombay prohibition act ( act xxv of 1949 ) he preferred an appeal to high court for enhancement of sentence notice issued to appellant to show cause against his conviction. appellant's appeal was dismissed summarily - after summary dismissal of appeal.

tagline: A.V. D'Costa vs B. C. Patel And Another on 4 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: second respondent had been employee of the central railway as a daily rated casual labourer on specified daily wages since 1941. he continued to receive his wages at the specified rate until 1949. in october 1949 he made an application through an official of the registered trade union - a person permitted under sub - section of s. 5 or s. 7 of act.

tagline: Shivnandan Sharma vs The Punjab National Bank Ltd on 15 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: appellant was appointed head cashier in one of the branches of the respondent bank by the treasurers who were in charge of the bank by virtue of an agreement between them. the question arose as to whether the appellant wasn't an employee. if a master employs a servant and authorizes him to employ a number of persons to do a particular job.

tagline: Suraj Pal vs The State Of Uttar Pradesh on 1 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: v. 302 and 307 of the code - legality - code of criminal procedure. the absence of specific charges in this case is a serious lacunas in the proceedings, inasmuch as the framing of a specific and distinct charge in respect of every distinct head of criminal liability constituting an offence.

tagline: The Divisional Engineer, G.I.P. ... vs Mahadeo Raghoo And Another on 2 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: first respondent drew this'allowance along with salary up to the 18th august 1948, when he refused to occupy the quarter offered to him. but he was offered a house rent allowance and home rent allowance was stopped from the date of his refusal. it is no more payable under the terms of the contract, but the allowance will not be admissible to those who occupy government quarters.

tagline: The State Of Bihar vs M. Homi And Another on 24 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: the sureties were entirely misconceived as the penalty stipulated had not been incurred. ali khan's appeal to the privy council was dismissed by the federal court. there is no room for the application of a legal fiction that the judgment of the court must be deemed to be the judgment or order.

tagline: Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak ... vs Raja Shiv Rattan Dev Singh And Ors. on 24 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: judgment jagannadhadas, j. 1, is an appeal from the judgment of the high court of punjab by leave. the appeal was filed in 1938 by the respondent herein, raja shiv rattan dev singh, raja of poonch. the case was remanded on first appeal and returned the case back to court.

tagline: N. Satyanathan vs K. Subramanyan And Others on 29 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: the appellant entered into agreement with central government for conveying postal articles and mail bags through motor vehicle se? vice on certain remuneration - appellant whether disqualified for election to house of people under s. 7 ( d ) of the act, 1951 ( act xliii ) of 1951. appellant had offered to contract with the governor - general for the provision of a motor vehicle service for the transit conveyance of all postal.

tagline: Bhim Sen vs The State Of U. P on 15 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: india's state of u. s. p. and third belonged to madhya pradesh state. section 52 ( 1 ) of the act provides certain specified offences ( including theft when the value of stolen property does 1445 not exceed rs. 50 / - a certain offence will be cognizable under the act by the panchayat adalat.

tagline: Dhirendra Nath Mitra And Anr. vs Mukanda Lal Sen on 1 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: four persons, including the two appellants, were prosecuted at the instance of a private complainant. chunder, j., issued rules against three of the accused but refused to issue one against the fourth. the complaintant applied in revision against the acquittals to the high court. the first accused obtained a decree authorising him to demolish certain huts in her possession.

tagline: Dasrath Gond And Ors. vs State Of Orissa on 15 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: judgment jagannadhadas, j. 1, was admitted only on the question of sentence. in the early part of the year 11952 small pox epidemic was prevalent in a virulent form in the village of badimal p. s. brajarajnagar, in sambalpur district.

tagline: Shiromani Gurdwara ... vs Lt. Sardar Raghbir Singh And ... on 24 March, 1955
summarized_judgment: a - committee constituted prior to the year 1930 - subsequent proceedings - high court's decision and notification under s. 17 of the act - suit for possession - starting point for limitation - ss. 85, 86, 88 of act's act, which means the present suit is barred by limitation. section 86 does not apply to gurudwara sri akal takht sabib.

tagline: Rai Sahib Ram Jawaya Kapur And Ors. vs The State Of Punjab on 12 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: petition under article 32 of the constitution is preferred by six persons who purport to carry on the business. petitioners pray for writs in the nature of mandamus directing punjab government to withdraw notifications. the education department has issued a series of notifications since 1950 regarding printing, publication and sale of these books.

tagline: M. K. Ranganathan And Another vs Government Of Madras And Others on 20 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: secured creditor is outside winding up and can realism his security without leaving court of any of the properties of the company'added in s. 232 ( 1 ) by the amending act xxii of 1936 have been used in juxtaposition with " any attachment, distress or execution put into force without leave of the court'it is also a well - recognized rule of construction that legislature does not intend to make a substantial alteration in the law beyond what it explicitly declares either in express words or by clear meaning.

tagline: Messrs Chatturam Horilram Ltd vs Commissioner Of Income Tax, Bihar ... on 18 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: indian finance act of 1939 brought into force retrospectively by bihar regulation iv of 1942. but that assessment was set aside by the income tax appellate tribunal on the ground that was not in force during the assessment year in chota nagpur. the appellant in this appeal had been assessed to income tax which was reduced on appeal.

tagline: Thakur Amar Singhji vs State Of Rajasthan(And Other ... on 15 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: rajasthan land reforms and resumption of jagirs act was approved by the rajpramukh on 8 - 2 - 1952. it came into force on 18 - 2 1952, and reserved for the consideration of the president who gave his assent to it on 13 - 2, 1952. in pursuance of s. 21 ( 1 ) of the act, the act came to be enacted in the ministerial department of rajasthan.

tagline: Anil Behari Ghosh vs Smt. Latika Bala Dassi And Others on 15 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: supreme court may refuse to grant annulment in cases where there is no likelihood of proof being offered that the will admitted to probate was either not genuine or had not been validly executed. india's supreme court was not satisfied that in all the circumum - stances of the present case just cause for the annullion of the grant of probate.

tagline: Rai Sahib Ram Jawaya Kapurand ... vs The State Of Punjab(And Connected ... on 22 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: the government approved some books on each subject as alternative text books. in 1952 a notification was issued by the government which omitted the word " publishers and authors " the government charged as royalty 5 % on the sale price of all the approved texts. the petitioners purport to carry on the business of preparing, printing, publishing and selling of the books.

tagline: The Registrar Of Trade Marks vs Ashok Chandra Rakhit Ltd on 15 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: sudhi ranjan bhagwati, natwarlal h. sinha, bhuvneshwar p, was the registrar of trade marks. registrar under s. 13 of the act is always a matter of discretion to be exercised, according to sound principles laid down for exercise of all judicial discretion.

tagline: The Delhi Cloth And General Mills ... vs Harnam Singh And Others on 21 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: cloth rationed at lyallpur, then part. of punjab in undivided india, and sales could only be made to government nominees and other authorised persons. cloth supplied the plaintiffs with cloth from time to time in accordance with government quota through branch manager. cloth was rationed to a part of the punjab in india and became " evacuees " in 1947.

tagline: Maharaj Umeg Slng And Others vs The State Of Bombay And Others on 6 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: goaraj umeg slng, natwarlal h. mukherjee and bhagwati are among the subjects of the indian state of bombay. clause 5 of the letters of guarantee itself saved the legislative right of the state subject to the limitation that enactments of state shall not be discriminatory in nature.

tagline: Director Of Endowments ... vs Akram Ali on 22 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: akram ali date of judgment in india's supreme court. he was given the chance to attend the hearing on the death penalty. the case is expected to be heard at the supreme court next month. india ’ s president has been given a six - month conditional discharge in the case.

tagline: Ram Shankar Singh And Ors. vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 19 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: judgment sinha, j. 1, is an appeal by special leave from the judgment and order of a single judge confirming those of sessions judge of azamgarh. on appeal, the learned judge acquitted three of them but maintained the conviction and sentence of the three appellants. the dacoits beat the complainant, some of them kept watch on the three.

tagline: Raj Kali Kuer vs Ram Rattan Pandey on 7 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: though a female is personally disqualified from officiating as a pujari for the shastrically installed and installed idols in the temples. the practice is not contrary to written hindu law nor opposed to public policy. the high court of patna reversed the judgment of the high - court reversed.

tagline: Rao Shiva Bahadur Singh vs The State Of Vindhya Pradesh And ... on 5 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: lokomo bahadur singh, bijan kr. ( cj ) das, sudhi ranjan bose, vivian sinha, bhuvneshwar p. ( bj ) gandhi, and imam jj. sinha j. dissenting : the whole matter is not repugnant to the constitution or the general principles of procedural law.

tagline: Om Prakash Gupta vs The State Of Uttar Pradesh on 21 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: appellant, a member of the united provinces civil service, was suspended from service with effect from the 24th august, 1944, pending an enquiry into his conduct. the appellant was given an alternative prayer for a declaration that the order of dismissal was 50 392 wrongful and for a decree for rs. 1, 20, 000 / - by way of damages passed in his favour.

tagline: Rao Shiva Bahadur Singh vs The State Of Vindhya Pradesh And ... on 7 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: judgment das, j. 1, is a petition for a writ in the nature of a writ. the facts leading up to the present petition are few and simple. petitioner's grievance is that he has been deprived of his liberty otherwise than in accordance with law law.

tagline: Shiva Jute Baling Ltd vs Hindley & Co. Ltd on 5 April, 1955
summarized_judgment: petitioners in case of an appellant for rescinding special leave under article 136 of the constitution procedure. petitioners furnished security amounts directed to be deposited within the time specified in the order. the application in the high court was kept pending until january 11, 1955. the petitioners were moved to the supreme court complaining of default on the part of the appellants in due prosecutions.
